017package org.microbean.loader;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020
021import java.util.function.Supplier;
022
023import org.microbean.invoke.FixedValueSupplier;
024
025import org.microbean.loader.api.Loader;
026
027import org.microbean.loader.spi.AbstractProvider;
028import org.microbean.loader.spi.Value;
029
030import org.microbean.path.Path;
031import org.microbean.path.Path.Element;
032
033import org.microbean.qualifier.Qualifiers;
034
035/**
036 * An {@link AbstractProvider} that provides access to {@linkplain
037 * System#getenv(String) environment variables}.
038 *
039 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
040 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
041 */
042public final class EnvironmentVariableProvider extends AbstractProvider {
043
044
045  /*
046   * Constructors.
047   */
048
049  
050  /**
051   * Creates a new {@link EnvironmentVariableProvider}.
052   */
053  public EnvironmentVariableProvider() {
054    super(String.class);
055  }
056
057
058  /*
059   * Instance methods.
060   */
061  
062
063  /**
064   * If the supplied {@code absolutePath} has a {@linkplain
065   * Path#size() size} of {@code 2} (the {@linkplain Path#root() root}
066   * plus a single name), returns a {@linkplain Value#determinism()
067   * deterministic <code>Value</code>} whose {@link Value#get()}
068   * method returns the {@linkplain System#getenv(String) environment
069   * variable} with that name, or {@code null} in all other cases.
070   *
071   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} requesting a {@link Value};
072   * must not be {@code null}
073   *
074   * @param absolutePath an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
075   * {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
076   *
077   * @return a {@linkplain Value#determinism() deterministic} {@link
078   * Value} whose {@link Value#get()} method returns the appropriate
079   * {@linkplain System#getenv(String) environment variable} if the
080   * supplied {@code absolutePath} has a {@linkplain Path#size() size}
081   * of {@code 2} (the {@linkplain Path#root() root} plus a single
082   * name) and there actually is a {@linkplain System#getenv(String)
083   * corresponding environment variable}; {@code null} in all other
084   * cases
085   *
086   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
087   *
088   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic during
089   * the lifetime of a Java virtual machine instance.
090   *
091   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
092   * threads.
093   *
094   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code requestor} or {@code
095   * absolutePath} is {@code null}
096   */
097  @Override // AbstractProvider<String>
098  public final Value<?> get(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
099    assert absolutePath.absolute();
100    assert absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.path());
101    assert !absolutePath.equals(requestor.path());
102
103    // On Unix systems, there is absolutely no question that the
104    // environment is entirely immutable, even when probed via
105    // System#getenv(String).  See
106    // https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/dfacda488bfbe2e11e8d607a6d08527710286982/src/java.base/unix/classes/java/lang/ProcessEnvironment.java#L67-L91.
107    //
108    // Things are ever so slightly more murky in Windows land.  As of
109    // JDK 17, the environment there is also entirely immutable:
110    // https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/dfacda488bfbe2e11e8d607a6d08527710286982/src/java.base/windows/classes/java/lang/ProcessEnvironment.java#L257-L258
111    // but the class is not as "immutable looking" as the Unix one and
112    // it seems to be designed for updating in some cases.
113    // Nevertheless, for the System#getenv(String) case, the
114    // environment is immutable.
115    //
116    // TL;DR: System.getenv("foo") will always return a value for
117    // "foo" if ever there was one, and will always return null if
118    // there wasn't.
119
120    if (absolutePath.size() == 2) { // 2: root plus a single name
121      final String name = absolutePath.lastElement().name();
122      if (!name.isEmpty()) {
123        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
124        final String value = System.getenv(name);
125        if (value != null) {
126          return new Value<>(FixedValueSupplier.of(value), absolutePath); // deterministic
127        }
128      }
129    }
130    return null;
131  }
132
133}
